page.title: 04TRANSPORT AROUND DOBWALLS
page.content: THE BLOCK IS SERVED BY TWO MAIN EAST WEST ROUTES, ONE ROAD, ONE RAIL. THE RAILWAY RUNS FROM PADDINGTON TO PENZANCE, AND THEREFORE LINKS THE BLOCK TO THE INTERCITY NETWORK. THE NEAREST STATION IS AT LISKEARD.THERE ARE 12 PASSENGER SERVICES RUNNING EACH WAY DAILY,AND 19 ON SATURDAYS IN THE SUMMER. 3 SPEEDLINK FREIGHT SERVICES ALSO RUN DAILY IN BOTH DIRECTIONS,AS WELL AS 2 CHINA CLAY TRAINS FROM MOORSWTER TO FOWEY. THE A38(T) RUNS THROUGH DOBWALLS, PROVIDING A FAST ROAD TO PLYMOUTH,BUT ALSO SPLITS THE VILLAGE IN HALF.IN THE SUMMER,TRAFFIC JAMS BUILD UP,CAUSING LOCAL DISTURBANCE.A BYPASS IS PLANNED. BUS SERVICES ARE LIMITED. 1 ROUTE GOES FROM DOBWALLS TO LISKEARD IN THE MORNINGS,PASSENGERS ALSO CATCH THE CORNWALL EXPRESS.THERE ARE NO BUSES IN THE EVENINGS.
